intro: Gyrotaenia myriocarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited gyrotaenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are often covered in fine hairs, which aid in seed dispersal. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
